title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: The software should provide a confirmation message when a user creates a new project and selects an existing directory as the output folder. The confirmation message should inform the user that the selected bin directory will be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new project.
2. Select an existing directory as the output folder.
3. Verify that the software displays a confirmation message stating that the selected bin directory will be deleted and rebuilt.
